articles.author: Theophilos Argitis
articles.title: Bank of Canada Holds Again, But Drops Its Cautious Language
articles.description: Canada’s central bank left interest rates on hold for a third straight decision Wednesday, but gave an upbeat assessment of the economy and removed some of its more cautious language, potentially indicating a greater willingness to return to a hiking cycle.

articles.author: Eric Newcomer, Olivia Zaleski
articles.title: Buffett Proposed $3 Billion Uber Investment But Deal Crumbled
articles.description: Warren Buffett proposed investing $3 billion in Uber Technologies Inc. earlier this year, but the talks fell apart following disagreements over the terms and size of the deal, people familiar with the matter said.

articles.author: Benjamin Bain, Robert Schmidt
articles.title: Wall Street Gets Win as Fed Set to Ease Volcker Trade Limits
articles.description: Wall Street’s long campaign to chip away at the toughest trading restriction imposed on banks after the financial crisis is finally paying off under President Donald Trump.

articles.author: Richard Bravo
articles.title: EU Braces for Trump Broadside as Deadline for Steel Tariff Looms
articles.description: The European Union is bracing for a trade offensive from President Donald Trump, amid a report the U.S. is poised to impose tariffs on steel and aluminum from the bloc.

articles.author: Bob Van Voris
articles.title: Ex-Goldman Sachs Banker Sues Federal Reserve Over Lifetime Ban
articles.description: A former Goldman Sachs Group Inc. banker facing a possible lifetime ban from the banking industry sued the Federal Reserve, claiming the regulator is taking to long to reach a final decision in his case.

articles.author: Frederic Tomesco
articles.title: CP Rail Strike Ends After Company Reaches Deal With Teamsters Union
articles.description: Canadian Pacific Railway Ltd. reached a tentative four-year deal with the Teamsters Canada Rail Conference, ending a strike that began late Tuesday.

articles.author: Josh Wingrove, Stephanie Flanders
articles.title: Trudeau Plays Longer Game Against ‘Ruthless’ U.S. Bottom Line
articles.description: Justin Trudeau wants to build a Canadian economy that will thrive a decade or more from now -- if that means losing a short-term edge to Donald Trump, so be it.

articles.author: Robert Tuttle, Kevin Orland
articles.title: Trudeau’s Pipeline Takeover Is a Bittersweet Win for Oil Sands
articles.description: Canada’s purchase of Kinder Morgan Inc.’s embattled pipeline is good news for the oil patch, so long as it doesn’t become the norm.

articles.author: Brian Chappatta
articles.title: Bill Gross Was Wide Awake During His Nightmare
articles.description: His Janus fund was positioned for a strong bear market, even though he predicted just a mild one.

articles.author: Nisha Gopalan
articles.title: Anbang’s Long, Slow Road to Redemption
articles.description: Don’t expect a fire sale by the Waldorf Astoria’s blighted Chinese owner.
